COMMENT_TX: Debut game for Kazuo Fukumori
Angels second baseman Howie Kendrick left the game due to an injured leg
Mariners right fielder Brad Wilkerson left the game due to an injured leg
Mariners pitcher Carlos Silva left the game due to an injured leg
$Mariners Manager John McLaren argued balls and strikes
ej,mclaj801,M,mosec901,Balls and strikes Mariners Manager John McLaren ejected by HP umpire Casey Moser
Mariners pitcher Miguel Batista left the game due to an injured groin
Mariners pitcher Jarrod Washburn left the game due to an injured foot/ankle
Rangers shortstop Michael Young left the game due to an injured leg
ej,mclaj801,M,wegnm901,Arguing Mariners Manager John McLaren ejected by HP umpire Mark Wegner

ej,sexsr001,P,fairc901,Charging the mound after high pitch $the second pitch to Richie Sexson was high; he charged the mound, throwing his helmet at Kason Gabbard; both benches and bullpens emptied and there was a lot of pushing and shoving; former Mariner Eddie Guardado held Felix Hernandez (who had hit two batters earlier) back from the scrum; Milton Bradley picked up Gerald Laird and carried him away from trouble; Bradley had been injured in 2007 when his manager tried to do the same; Mariners first baseman Richie Sexson ejected by HP umpire Chad Fairchild
Rangers pitcher Kason Gabbard left the game due to an injured leg
originally DI, changed to SB on 5-19

ej,lugoj001,P,herna901,Asking for check swing call ej,frant001,M,herna901,Arguing about Lugo ejection $Julio Lugo asked 3B umpire Angel Hernandez for a check-swing ruling on ball four to Ibanez; they argued and Hernandez ejected Lugo; Boston manager Terry Francona went out to get Lugo off the field; he asked Hernandez a question and then reacted to the answer; Hernandez ejected Francona
$home run #499 for Ramirez
Debut game for Jeff Larish

ej,leylj801,M,iassd901,Call at 1B on Granderson $Mariners 3Bman Adrian Beltre was in foul territory when he made the throw to 1B; umpire Dan Iassogna ruled that Miguel Cairo had his foot on the bag when he caught the wide throw; Granderson and manager Jim Leyland argued the call; Leyland was ejected by Iassogna
fan interference

ej,silvc001,P,welkb901,Call at 1B Mariners pitcher Carlos Silva ejected by 1B umpire Bill Welke for throwing up his arms and swearing at Welke after the safe call at 1B; Silva then had to be restrained by manager John McLaren
ej,rodri001,P,knigb901,Balls and strikes Tigers catcher Ivan Rodriguez ejected by HP umpire Brian Knight
Debut game for Bryan LaHair
Mariners pitcher Carlos Silva left the game due to an injured back
$the ball struck Lester's right shin
Mariners catcher Jeff Clement left the game due to an injured hand/wrist
$Willie Bloomquist called for interference

Orioles designated hitter Aubrey Huff was waslking from the clubhouse to the dugout, heard the crowd roar, jumped up and banged his head on the concrete ceiling; he was bleeding and bruised and left the game; he said that he would not have left the game except for the Orioles' big lead
$Frank Thomas was upset with HP umpire Bill Hohn about strike three and discussed it with the umpire

ej,thomf001,P,hohnb901,Balls and strikes Athletics designated hitter Frank Thomas angrily spun away from the plate after the first pitch was called a strike by HP umpire Bill Hohn; Thomas took a short walk and was talking to himself when he was ejected by Hohn; Thomas then started arguing with Hohn and threw his helmet and bat towards the plate as he went back to the dugout
Debut game for Matt Tuiasosopo

$Yuniesky Betancourt broke for 2B too soon and was picked off by Sidney Ponson; Betancourt was caught in a rundown but was awarded 2B when he ran into Ponson, who was charged with obstruction and an error
Rangers designated hitter Milton Bradley strained a muscle in his back swinging at the first pitch and left the game

replay,5,guerv001,ANA,welkt901,SEA03,F,N,I,,H $Vladimir Guerrero hit a ball down the left field line that hit just to the foul side of the pole and bounced back onto the field; 3B umpire Chuck Meriwether called it foul but Angels manager Mike Scioscia came onto the field to talk about the call; the umpires huddled and then crew chief Tim Welke watched the replay and upheld the call; this was the fifth use or replay
